subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Hindu Creation: The Cosmic Egg
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hindu Creation: The Cosmic Egg usable.

hook.text: Before the universe, there was nothing. Then a golden egg appeared in darkness. Brahma hatched from it and created all.

buildup.text: The Rig Veda's creation hymn admits uncertainty: 'Who really knows? Perhaps even the gods came after creation.'

discovery.text: Hindu creation is cyclical, not linear. The universe is created, destroyed, and recreated endlessly by Brahma.

twist.text: Each cosmic cycle lasts 4.32 billion years. Modern science estimates Earth at 4.5 billion. The parallel is striking.

climax.text: Hindu cosmology imagined deep time millennia before science. Some truths are reached by myth before measurement.

punchline.text: A golden egg, 4.32 billion years. Myth and science surprisingly agree.

quiz.question: What makes Hindu creation distinct from the Genesis story?
options: It's cyclical, not a one-time event
